author: bdenny
msg: Resolves Issue #1108 ('svn log' for switched file reports for unswitched
Along the way, makes the following bugfixes/improvements:
- svn_path_condense_targets no longer trims the first character off of the
returned targets if they have no common basepath.
- svn_path_get_longest_ancestor now really does return NULL if there is no
common ancestor, like its documentation says; and callers of this
function check for a NULL return value.
svn_path_condense_targets now handle URLs more intelligently.
(svn_path_condense_targets): Accept URL targets; don't try to convert
them to absolute paths.  Make sure to accept NULL return values from
(get_longest_path_ancestor): New helper function, mostly identical with
the old svn_path_get_longest_ancestor, but fixed to return NULL if there
is no common ancestor, as per the svn_path_get_longest_ancestor docstring.
(svn_path_get_absolute): Accept URL targets; treat them as absolute paths.
(repos_to_repos_copy): Handle a NULL return value from
(svn_client_log): Find the URL for each target, and send the list of
URLs, not file targets, to svn_path_condense_targets.
(svn_client__condense_commit_items): Handle a NULL return value from

author: gstein
msg: This tool consumes some data that I extracted from the SVN IssueZilla
database. It can produce a simple textual summary, or with the help of
gnuplot, can produce a nifty graph.
The intent is to use this as an example for more interesting types of
data extraction. More scripts or other reductions of the data at
* tools/dev/iz/find-fix.py: new script. it is quite a hacky first cut
intended to just get a graph done.
* tools/dev/iz/defect.dem: another rough cut at a gnuplot input file

author: rooneg
msg: Remove the optional_adm_access parameter from svn_client_delete.
(svn_client_delete): update function signature and factor out most of
the code (everything but creating the svn_wc_adm_access_t for the wc
(svn_client__delete): new function, holds the guts of svn_client_delete.

author: sussman
msg: server_ssl_prompt_first_cred) : set iter_baton reference to NULL
server_ssl_prompt_first_cred) : do not return credentials if not all
initializer, use intermediate "void *creds" to avoid aliasing warning
